question.title: Why Quarkus application cannot read Unleash feature toggle?
question.body:
I am trying to utilize Unleash in my Quarkus application. I have set up a minimal application that consists of an endpoint as well as a service class. I am using the official Quarkus Unleash Extension along with Dev Services on a fixed port that spins up an Unleash server and a Postgres container. The next steps are the following:

  1. Access the Unleash UI in my browser
  2. Create a new Feature Toggle as Release
  3. Activate the Feature Toggle using the Standard Strategy
  4. Call the endpoint of my Quarkus Application through Postman

The problem is that always the Hello from Quarkus REST (default) message gets invoked. I am not really sure what am I doing wrong and I would like your suggestions or assumptions. I am also providing my application.properties file for more context.

Endpoint

@Path("/hello")
public class GreetingResource {

    @Inject
    UnleashService unleashService;

    @GET
    @Produces(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN)
    public String hello() {
        if (unleashService.isTest()) {
            return "ðŸš€ Feature is ENABLED!";
        } else {
            return "Hello from Quarkus REST (default)";
        }
    }
}

Service

@ApplicationScoped
public class UnleashService {

    @Inject
    Unleash unleash;

    public boolean isTest() {
        return unleash.isEnabled("quarkus");
    }
}

application.properties

# Configure the application name
quarkus.application.name=feature-toggles

# Configure Unleash
quarkus.unleash.project=default
quarkus.unleash.environment=development
quarkus.unleash.application=feature-toggles
quarkus.unleash.synchronous-fetch-on-initialisation=true
quarkus.unleash.devservices.port=36075
quarkus.unleash.devservices.db.image-name=docker.io/library/postgres:17
quarkus.unleash.devservices.log=true
quarkus.unleash.devservices.reuse=true

Feature Toggle
